Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
What is the meaning of the word DRIFT as it is used in paragraph 18 of “Just Like Home”?

A.Choice: consider

B.Choice: wander

C.Choice: change

D.Choice: hover

Content: Which detail from the story helps the reader understand the meaning of DRIFT?

A.Choice: Priya, Enrique, and Farah create drawings that have different colors and shapes.

B.Choice: Jasper studies the drawings and decides they look like tropical fish swimming in a coral reef.

C.Choice: Lily, Jasper, and Enrique make comments about the drawings as the students come close enough to see them.

D.Choice: Priya smiles when her teacher and classmates show an interest in the drawings by describing them to one another.

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Priya from “Just Like Home” would agree with which statement?

A.Choice: Sharing family traditions can bring comfort.

B.Choice: Working together is the best way to achieve success.

C.Choice: Using imagination often makes ordinary situations exciting.

D.Choice: Making quick decisions can sometimes bring the best results.

Content: Which paragraph from the story supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: paragraph 3

B.Choice: paragraph 11

C.Choice: paragraph 19

D.Choice: paragraph 22

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
In “Just Like Home,” what can be learned about Priya from her statement, “It looks like home”?

A.Choice: She believes imagination improves art.

B.Choice: She realizes many of her classmates have artistic talent.

C.Choice: She misses the family traditions in India.

D.Choice: She wishes she could spend time with her friends in India.

Content: Which detail supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “At her old school, she spent recess climbing the monkey bars and sharing secrets with her friends.” (paragraph 1)

B.Choice: “While she and her classmates filed through the halls and out into the yard, Priya thought about how she and her mother used to draw chalk patterns on the long driveway leading up to their old apartment building.” (paragraph 4)

C.Choice: “Then he drew circles inside circles, and surrounded them with small diamonds. Priya kept drawing too, in between and around Enrique's designs.” (paragraph 11)

D.Choice: “Priya, Enrique and Farah stood up and looked at what they had done. The pavement was covered in bright colors and shapes: triangles, circles, squares and diamonds, all mixed together.” (paragraph 18)

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
What is the meaning of lines 37–38 of “Life Doesn't Frighten Me”?

:box:I've got a magic charm
That I keep up my sleeve,

A.Choice: a secret talent to use when the time is right

B.Choice: a symbol of the speaker's imagination

C.Choice: a special treasure hidden from cruel classmates

D.Choice: a scary experience in the speaker's nightmares

Content: Which lines from the poem BEST demonstrate the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: lines 10–11

B.Choice: lines 28–29

C.Choice: lines 35–36

D.Choice: lines 39–40

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which sentence summarizes the speaker's thoughts in “Life Doesn't Frighten Me”?

A.Choice: Some challenges are much more difficult than others.

B.Choice: Dreams can be helpful when solving problems.

C.Choice: Confidence is the best weapon against fear.

D.Choice: Being alone is the scariest place to be.

Content: Which lines from the poem show evidence of the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: lines 1–2

B.Choice: lines 10–11

C.Choice: lines 19–20

D.Choice: lines 35–36

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
The author of the story “Just Like Home” uses different structural elements than the poet of the poem “Life Doesn't Frighten Me.”
Which structural element is found only in the story?

A.Choice: setting

B.Choice: dialogue

C.Choice: description

D.Choice: rhythm

Content: Which evidence from the story supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “Now she sat in the corner of the field and watched the other kids play without her.” (paragraph 1)

B.Choice: “The patterns were called rangoli, and they looked like stars and roses.” (paragraph 4)

C.Choice: “The pavement was covered in bright colors and shapes: triangles, circles, squares and diamonds, all mixed together.” (paragraph 18)

D.Choice: “'It looks like a universe, with lots of planets and stars,' said Lily.” (paragraph 19)

Content: Identify a theme in “Just Like Home” and a theme in “Life Doesn't Frighten Me.” Write an essay that explains how the theme of the story is shown through the characters and how the theme of the poem is shown through the speaker. Include specific details from the story and the poem to support your essay.
:ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which sentence from the story helps the reader understand the meaning of DISPUTING as it is used in paragraph 1?

A.Choice: “'Heyday, sirs!' said His Majesty, going up to them, 'let me know the cause of your quarrel.'” (paragraph 5)

B.Choice: “Upon hearing this, off they started.” (paragraph 10)

C.Choice: “The latter, seeing at a glance how matters stood, extended his long trunk, and reached the helmet quite easily.” (paragraph 11)

D.Choice: “'And you,' said the Lion, turning to the Crocodile, 'although unable to reach the helmet, were able to dive for it and save it.'” (paragraph 13)

Content: Which word has the opposite meaning of DISPUTING?

A.Choice: confessing

B.Choice: discussing

C.Choice: questioning

D.Choice: agreeing

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
How does the Lion react to the question the Elephant and the Crocodile ask in paragraph 6?

A.Choice: He disappoints them by refusing to answer.

B.Choice: He causes conflict by proposing a silly contest.

C.Choice: He shows interest in helping them solve their problem.

D.Choice: He addresses them as if they are less important than he is.

Content: Which detail from the story provides evidence for the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “'Do you see that soldier's steel helmet on yonder wall?'” (paragraph 7)

B.Choice: “'... go and fetch it, and bring it to me, and I shall be able then to decide between you.'” (paragraph 9)

C.Choice: “His Majesty took up the helmet...” (paragraph 12)

D.Choice: “'You, on account of your size and trunk, were able to reach the prize on the wall but, having lost it, you were unable to recover it.'” (paragraph 13)

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which character trait best describes the Lion?

A.Choice: wise

B.Choice: brave

C.Choice: kind

D.Choice: humorous

Content: Which quotation from the story supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “Just as they were coming to blows, a Lion happened to pass.” (paragraph 4)

B.Choice: “'Do you see that soldier's steel helmet on yonder wall? ...'” (paragraph 7)

C.Choice: “'Well, then,' continued the Lion, 'go and fetch it, and bring it to me, and I shall be able to decide between you.'” (paragraph 9)

D.Choice: “'Neither is better than the other.'” (paragraph 13)

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which sentence BEST states a theme in the story?

A.Choice: We all have different strengths.

B.Choice: We should try to be patient with others.

C.Choice: We all have the power to help others.

D.Choice: We should always put forth our best efforts.

Content: Which detail from the story BEST shows this theme?

A.Choice: “'Ah! but quantity is not quality, and your skin is not nearly so tough as mine...'” (paragraph 3)

B.Choice: “The Crocodile, being used to the water, reached the opposite bank of the river first...” (paragraph 10)

C.Choice: “... a sudden lurch caused the prize to slip off and sink to the bottom.” (paragraph 12)

D.Choice: “'You are both wise and clever in your respective ways.'” (paragraph 13)

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Read the sentence from paragraph 7 of “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island.”
:box:Assateague's horses are uniquely adapted to survive on a barrier island.
What does the word ADAPTED mean as it is used in the sentence?

A.Choice: chosen because of a gentle manner

B.Choice: changed in order to fit certain conditions

C.Choice: cared for because of harsh living conditions

D.Choice: colored in order to match the surroundings

Content: Which statement from “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island” BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “Genetically they are considered horses, even though they are now pony size.”

B.Choice: “Many of the horses live in the marshes close to their best food sources.”

C.Choice: “Foals are usually born in late spring ...”

D.Choice: “This helps maintain a hardy, healthy population of wild horses.”

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which statement provides the BEST explanation of why the Assateague horses have survived on the barrier island for so long?

A.Choice: The townspeople have kept the horses as pets for many years.

B.Choice: The horses are protected when visitors drive cautiously.

C.Choice: The horses adjusted to the island.

D.Choice: The fire department provides the horses with some veterinary care.

Content: Which sentence from “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island” BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “The wild horses of Assateague Island are descendants of domesticated animals brought to the island over 300 years ago.”

B.Choice: “The Assateague horses drink over twice the amount of water that domesticated horses will due to their salty food supply.”

C.Choice: “Virginia's horses are privately owned by the Chincoteague Volunteer Fire Department and receive some veterinary care.”

D.Choice: “You can often see the horses and other wildlife by driving slowly along park roads.”

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which statement about how the horses came to live on Assateague Island has the MOST support in “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island”?

A.Choice: The horses were placed on the island by the government.

B.Choice: The horses swam to the island after a shipwreck.

C.Choice: The horses were put on the island by farmers.

D.Choice: The horses were native to the island.

Content: Which phrase from “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island” BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “... dramatic tale of struggle and survival ...”

B.Choice: “... descendants of those hardy animals turned loose ...”

C.Choice: “... owned and managed by the National Park Service.”

D.Choice: “... free-roaming wildlife and could be anywhere ...”

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which statement BEST explains why the ponies travel from Assateague Island to Chincoteague Island?

A.Choice: On Chincoteague Island, there is more food for large numbers of ponies to eat.

B.Choice: On Assateague Island, the poor weather is harmful to the ponies.

C.Choice: On Chincoteague Island, there is better grass for the ponies to graze.

D.Choice: On Assateague Island, there is limited space for large numbers of ponies to live.

Content: Which sentence from “Wild Ponies of Chincoteague” BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “To keep the herd from getting too big, some new foals are sold each year at auction ...”

B.Choice: “The 'Saltwater Cowboys' were rounding them up.”

C.Choice: “Some slept, and some of the foals suckled their mothers' milk.”

D.Choice: “They were getting their strength back for the next event.”

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
How does the author MAINLY organize the information in “Wild Ponies of Chincoteague”?

A.Choice: by stating a problem and how it can be solved

B.Choice: by stating a point of view and then comparing ideas

C.Choice: by explaining the causes and effects of an event

D.Choice: by explaining events in the order that they happened

Content: Which sentence from the article supports the structure in the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “The weather was wet and dreary, and I felt like an icicle as raindrops fell cold against my cheeks.”

B.Choice: “First, I heard faint whinnying sounds drifting through the salty air.”

C.Choice: “My sisters and I sloshed through the mud to get to the corral where the ponies were held for the auction.”

D.Choice: “The pony was strong and spirited, and I had to hold him back.”

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which statement BEST describes a difference between the information in “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island” and the information in “Wild Ponies of Chincoteague”?

A.Choice: “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island” tells more about the work people do with horses.

B.Choice: “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island” tells more about what it is like to visit the horses.

C.Choice: “Wild Ponies of Chincoteague” includes more information about how the horses first came to the island.

D.Choice: “Wild Ponies of Chincoteague” includes more information about how people feel about the horses.

Content: Which sentence BEST supports the answer to Part A?

A.Choice: “During the 17th century free-roaming horses, cows, sheep and pigs caused expensive crop damage to local farms.” (“The Wild Horses of Assateague Island”)

B.Choice: “Virginia's horses are privately owned by the Chincoteague Volunteer Fire Department and receive some veterinary care.” (“The Wild Horses of Assateague Island”)

C.Choice: “I loved the ponies at first sight!” (“Wild Ponies of Chincoteague”)

D.Choice: “The cowboys were herding them right down Main Street!” (“Wild Ponies of Chincoteague”)

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
What is the meaning of the phrase torrential downpour as it is used in paragraph 17 of the article?

A.Choice: an event that lasts longer than expected

B.Choice: a time of day when ocean water is calm and still

C.Choice: a heavy rainfall during a storm

D.Choice: a chance to see unusual animal behavior

Content: Which paragraph from the article BEST helps the reader understand the meaning of TORRENTIAL DOWNPOUR?

A.Choice: paragraph 2

B.Choice: paragraph 6

C.Choice: paragraph 13

D.Choice: paragraph 18

Content: :ibox:THIS PROBLEM HAS TWO PARTS.
Which statement describes a main idea of the article?

A.Choice: People had trouble seeing the ponies because more visitors arrived than were expected.

B.Choice: Severe weather caused concern for the people involved in the event, but the ponies still crossed the channel successfully.

C.Choice: The pony swim takes place every year, and people come from all over the world to see it.

D.Choice: Some people choose the yearly pony event as a special trip to take with their families.

Content: Which sentence from the article BEST supports the answer in Part A?

A.Choice: “'We had no idea whatsoever about this storm,' said Denise Bowden, vice president of the Chincoteague Volunteer Fire Department.”

B.Choice: “Thousands come from across the United States and beyond.”

C.Choice: “'Outside of the weather, it was a perfect swim,' she said.”

D.Choice: “Poppy Hendrickson-Hoersting, 10, convinced her family to fly from Oregon to see the swim.”

Content: You have read a passage from “The Wild Horses of Assateague Island,” “Wild Ponies of Chincoteague,” and “In Thunder and Rain, Chincoteague Ponies Make Annual Swim.” Think about the illustrations from the passages and how they help the reader learn more about the ponies.
Write an essay explaining what can be learned from the illustrations about the lives of the ponies described in the passages. Include details from all three sources in your explanation.
